death_place.zh-cn: 北京市中国人民解放军总医院

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党党员，毛泽东与杨开慧的次子，患有精神疾病。曾在中共中央宣传部马列著作编译室任俄文翻译，翻译出版了多部马列著作和政治理论书籍。
description.en: A member of the Communist Party of China, the second son of Mao Zedong and Yang Kaihui, who suffered from mental illness. He worked as a Russian translator in the Compilation and Translation Bureau of Marxist-Leninist Works of the Propaganda Department of the CCP Central Committee, translating and publishing multiple works of Marxism-Leninism and political theory books.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家、军事家，中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和第一代最高领导人。
description.en: Chinese communist revolutionary, politician and military strategist who was the founder of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第二任妻子，毛岸英、毛岸青、毛岸龙的母亲。
description.en: The second wife of Mao Zedong and mother of Mao Anying, Mao Anqing, and Mao Anlong.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸青的妻子，毛新宇的母亲，中国人民解放军少将，曾任中国摄影家协会主席。
description.en: Wife of Mao Anqing, mother of Mao Xinyu, a major general in the People's Liberation Army, and former chairwoman of the China Photographers Association.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东与杨开慧的长子，毛岸青的兄长，在朝鲜战争中阵亡。
description.en: The eldest son of Mao Zedong and Yang Kaihui, older brother of Mao Anqing, who was killed in action during the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东与杨开慧的第三子。
description.en: The third son of Mao Zedong and Yang Kaihui.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸青与邵华之子，毛泽东唯一的嫡孙。
description.en: The son of Mao Anqing and Shao Hua, and the only known grandson of Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第一任妻子。
description.en: The first wife of Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第三任妻子。
description.en: The third wife of Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第四任妻子，“四人帮”成员之一。
description.en: The fourth wife of Mao Zedong, and a member of the Gang of Four.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，曾任湖南省政府主席，因“清党”而闻名。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China, former chairman of the Hunan provincial government, known for his role in the Kuomintang purges.

description.zh-cn: 1927年由中国国民党右派发动的政治清洗运动，旨在清除党内的共产党员及左派人士。
description.en: A political purge initiated by the right-wing of the Kuomintang in 1927 to eliminate communists and leftists from the party.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪30年代由中共地下党在上海创办，用于收养中共烈士和领导人的子女。
description.en: A kindergarten founded by the CCP underground in Shanghai in the 1930s to care for the children of CCP martyrs and leaders.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党情报人员，曾受党组织委托照顾毛岸英、毛岸青兄弟。
description.en: An intelligence officer of the Communist Party of China, who was entrusted by the party to take care of the brothers Mao Anying and Mao Anqing.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国将领，奉系军阀首领张作霖之子，曾发动西安事变。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China, son of Fengtian warlord leader Zhang Zuolin, who initiated the Xi'an Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代文艺理论家、诗人和作家，曾负责上海地下党工作。
description.en: A modern Chinese literary theorist, poet, and writer, who was once in charge of the underground party work in Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，东北抗日义勇军领导人之一。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China and one of the leaders of the Northeast Anti-Japanese Volunteer Armies.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人之一，曾任中共驻共产国际代表团副团长。
description.en: A former senior leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as the deputy head of the CCP delegation to the Comintern.

description.zh-cn: 位于苏联莫斯科的国际儿童院，主要接收各国共产党领导人的子女。
description.en: An international children's home in Moscow, Soviet Union, which mainly housed the children of communist leaders from various countries.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战期间苏联与纳粹德国及其盟国之间发生的战争。
description.en: The war between the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany and its allies during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The founding and ruling political party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期，由中国共产党领导的土地所有制改革运动。
description.en: A land ownership reform movement led by the Communist Party of China in the early days of the People's Republic of China.

en: Propaganda Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 毛岸英是毛岸青的同胞兄长。
description.en: Mao Anying was Mao Anqing's full brother.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸龙是毛岸青的同胞弟弟。
description.en: Mao Anlong was Mao Anqing's full brother.

description.zh-cn: 罗一秀是毛岸青的嫡母。
description.en: Luo Yixiu was Mao Anqing's formal stepmother.

description.zh-cn: 贺子珍是毛岸青的继母。
description.en: He Zizhen was Mao Anqing's stepmother.

description.zh-cn: 江青是毛岸青的继母。
description.en: Jiang Qing was Mao Anqing's stepmother.

description.zh-cn: 1967年，江青到北京大学发表演说，控诉邵华“主动送上门”勾引毛岸青。
description.en: In 1967, Jiang Qing gave a speech at Peking University, accusing Shao Hua of 'offering herself' to seduce Mao Anqing.

description.zh-cn: 1930年11月14日，杨开慧被湖南清乡公署会办何键下令处决。
description.en: On November 14, 1930, Yang Kaihui was executed by order of He Jian, co-director of the Hunan Pacification Office.

description.zh-cn: 1927年，因国民党在湖南开始清党，杨开慧带着儿子们到乡下躲避，最终导致其被捕并被处决。
description.en: In 1927, due to the Kuomintang's purge in Hunan, Yang Kaihui took her sons to hide in the countryside, which ultimately led to her capture and execution.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸英于1950年11月下旬在参与朝鲜战争时阵亡。
description.en: Mao Anying was killed in action in late November 1950 while participating in the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 1931年至1932年3月，毛岸青与兄弟在中共地下党所办的大同幼稚园生活。
description.en: From 1931 to March 1932, Mao Anqing and his brothers lived in the Datong Kindergarten run by the CCP underground.

description.zh-cn: 1932年大同幼稚园解散后，董健吾将毛岸英、毛岸青兄弟接到家中抚养。
description.en: After the Datong Kindergarten was dissolved in 1932, Dong Jianwu took the brothers Mao Anying and Mao Anqing into his home to raise them.

description.zh-cn: 应董健吾请求，张学良帮助安排将毛岸英、毛岸青兄弟送往苏联学习。
description.en: At the request of Dong Jianwu, Zhang Xueliang helped arrange for the brothers Mao Anying and Mao Anqing to be sent to the Soviet Union to study.

description.zh-cn: 1936年4月，冯雪峰向董健吾传达了中共中央将毛岸英、毛岸青兄弟送往苏联国际保育院的指示。
description.en: In April 1936, Feng Xuefeng conveyed the CCP Central Committee's instructions to Dong Jianwu to send the brothers Mao Anying and Mao Anqing to an international nursery in the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 1936年，李杜带领毛岸英、毛岸青等人，经法国前往苏联。
description.en: In 1936, Li Du led Mao Anying, Mao Anqing and others to the Soviet Union via France.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸英、毛岸青兄弟在抵达巴黎后，见到了专程前来迎接的中共驻共产国际代表团副团长康生。
description.en: After arriving in Paris, the brothers Mao Anying and Mao Anqing met Kang Sheng, deputy head of the CCP delegation to the Comintern, who had come specifically to welcome them.

description.zh-cn: 在苏德战争中，毛岸青参加了挖战壕、运伤员等支前活动。
description.en: During the Soviet-German War, Mao Anqing participated in support activities such as digging trenches and transporting the wounded.

description.zh-cn: 1947年，与蔡畅一同介绍毛岸青加入中国共产党。
description.en: In 1947, along with Cai Chang, introduced Mao Anqing to join the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 1947年，与李富春一同介绍毛岸青加入中国共产党。
description.en: In 1947, along with Li Fuchun, introduced Mao Anqing to join the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 1947年到1948年，毛岸青在黑龙江省克山县进行土改工作。
description.en: From 1947 to 1948, Mao Anqing carried out land reform work in Keshan County, Heilongjiang Province.

position.zh-cn: 马列著作编译室俄文翻译
position.en: Russian Translator at the Bureau for the Compilation and Translation of Works of Marx, Engels, Lenin, and Stalin

description.zh-cn: 1960年1月，与张文秋以亲家形式撮合了毛岸青与邵华的婚姻。
description.en: In January 1960, along with Zhang Wenqiu, arranged the marriage between Mao Anqing and Shao Hua.

description.zh-cn: 1960年1月，与毛泽东以亲家形式撮合了毛岸青与其次女邵华的婚姻。
description.en: In January 1960, along with Mao Zedong, arranged the marriage between Mao Anqing and her second daughter, Shao Hua.

description.zh-cn: 2008年12月21日，毛岸青的骨灰迁葬于杨开慧烈士陵园内。
description.en: On December 21, 2008, Mao Anqing's ashes were moved and buried in the Yang Kaihui Martyrs' Cemetery.
